However, their holiday takes a hellish turn when a biblical apocalypse engulfs the city, and they find themselves trapped at the centre of the mayhem. Horror, starring Yael Grobglas and Danielle Jadelyn.

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: Detectives hunt a killer who kidnaps his victims and forces them to play sadistic games with life-or-death consequences. Meanwhile, two strangers wake to find themselves chained to pipes in a filthy, derelict bathroom - and at the mercy of the madman, who sets them a twisted challenge. Horror, written by and starring Leigh Whannell, alongside Cary Elwes, Danny Glover and Dina Meyer.(n)

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: The sinister criminal Jigsaw is preparing to mete out his deranged and sadistic form of justice on more hapless victims. Meanwhile, a cop is desperately searching for the madman and the gruesome prison where he is holding eight terrified strangers. Horror sequel, starring Tobin Bell, Donnie Wahlberg, Shawnee Smith and Franky G.(n)

programme.title: Target Earth
programme.desc: Former alien abductees fight fellow victims of extraterrestrial attacks who have been brainwashed into taking over the planet. Sci-fi adventure, starring Christopher Meloni, Marcia Cross and Dabney Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Stage Fright
programme.desc: A hopeful young singer is terrorised by a masked killer at a performing-arts camp. Horror musical, starring Allie MacDonald, Meat Loaf Aday and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The NeverEnding Story
programme.desc: A lonely boy, neglected by his father and bullied at school, finds comfort in a mysterious book about a young hero's quest to save his world from destruction. However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Fantasy adventure based on Michael Edne's novel, starring Barret Oliver, Noah Hathaway, Gerald McRaney, Moses Gunn and Patricia Hayes.(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Scientists create a clone of Ripley to get hold of the alien queen growing inside her body and breed a new race of the monsters. However, when the creatures escape and turn on their makers, the new Ripley must lead a smuggling crew caught up in the mayhem to safety. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Sigourney Weaver, Winona Ryder and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: A virus sweeps across America turning people into zombies, and the government establishes measures to capture those infected and dispose of them once the process is complete. When a teenage girl is infected, her devoted father refuses to hand her over to the authorities, and vows to defend her to the bitter end. Horror, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Abigail Breslin.(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogramme the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: The NeverEnding Story

However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel.(n)

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: A 13-year-old boy raised in South Africa's Cape Flats gets caught up in a volatile subculture dominated by two rival gangs. Thriller, starring Brendon Daniels, Jezriel Skei and Lindiwe Matshikiza.

programme.title: Klute
programme.desc: A private detective investigates the disappearance of a scientist in New York, but finds his only lead is a prostitute with a tenuous connection to the missing man - and his attempts to gain her help are soon hampered by shadowy figures intent on silencing her. Alan J Pakula's thriller, starring Donald Sutherland, Roy Scheider and an Oscar-winning Jane Fonda.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: A British colonel in a Japanese PoW camp is ordered to build a railway bridge over a river, forging a vital communications link. At first he refuses to obey, but eventually agrees to take the project on - and becomes so obsessed with the task that he creates a dilemma for an American soldier sent to destroy the structure. David Lean's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins.

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou
programme.desc: Three bumbling crooks escape from a chain gang and strive to get their hands on some hidden loot, but encounter all manner of scrapes and strange characters along the way. The Coen brothers' comedy inspired by Homer's Odyssey, starring George Clooney, John Turturro, Tim Blake Nelson, John Goodman and Holly Hunter.

programme.title: Tangerines
programme.desc: In the Apkhazeti region of Georgia in 1990, an Estonian man has stayed behind to harvest his crops of tangerines, but when a wounded man is left behind, he is forced to take him in. Drama, starring Lembit Ulfsak, Giorgi Nakashidze and Elmo Nuganen. In Estonian, Russian and Georgian.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves.

programme.title: Zulu
programme.desc: An upper-class soldier and his fellow officer stationed at Rorke's Drift in 1879 discover they have been cut off after the destruction of the main British army column in the area. They must rally their small force of 140 men against the might of 4,000 Zulu warriors advancing on their position. Fact-based historical drama, starring Michael Caine, Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, Nigel Green and Chief Buthelezi, with narration by Richard Burton.

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Straight-shooting peacemakers Everett and Virgil try to restore order in a town under the control of crooked rancher Randall and his murderous gang. However, the pair find their friendship threatened by the arrival of attractive widow Allison, who leads Virgil to question his nomadic existence. Western, starring Ed Harris, Viggo Mortensen, Jeremy Irons and Renee Zellweger.

programme.title: The Salvation
programme.desc: A Danish settler in the Wild West is joined by his wife and son, but they are soon murdered. He avenges their deaths, but his actions attract the wrath of a ruthless gang leader. Abandoned by his friends and neighbours, the peaceful pioneer is forced to stand alone to enforce the law in his new home. Western, starring Mads Mikkelsen and Eva Green.

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou
programme.desc: Three bumbling crooks escape from a chain gang and strive to get their hands on some hidden loot, but encounter all manner of scrapes and strange characters along the way. The Coen brothers' comedy inspired by Homer's Odyssey, starring George Clooney, John Turturro, Tim Blake Nelson, John Goodman and Holly Hunter.

programme.title: The Overnight
programme.desc: A couple and their young son move to another city, and find themselves feeling adrift in a strange place. Things seem to change for the better when they meet another family and spend the evening at their new friends' house - but things quickly take a disturbing turn once the kids are in bed. Black comedy, starring Adam Scott, Taylor Schilling and Jason Schwartzman.

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Confederate soldier refuses to surrender at the end of the Civil War, and is branded a dangerous outlaw. Crossing America in search of sanctuary from the army and bounty hunters, he only wants solitude - but ends up with a strange assortment of travelling companions. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Chief Dan George and Sondra Locke.

programme.title: The Devils
programme.desc: A sexually liberated priest in 17th-century France attracts the hatred of the King and the church with his radical views. When an obsessed nun accuses him of witchcraft, the cleric's enemies strike, using increasingly brutal tactics in their efforts to prove him a heretic. Ken Russell's historical drama, starring Oliver Reed and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Who's That Knocking at My Door
programme.desc: Harvey Keitel plays a tough Italian-American who prefers hanging out with a rough and ready street gang to spending time with his increasingly frustrated girlfriend. Urban crime story, with Zina Bethune and Anne Colette.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician.(n)

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: An elite group of Allied soldiers is dispatched to sabotage vital German artillery emplacements, despite the seemingly insurmountable odds and the suspicion there is a traitor in their midst. Oscar-winning Second World War adventure, based on Alistair MacLean's novel, starring Gregory Peck, David Niven, Anthony Quinn, Stanley Baker, Anthony Quayle and Irene Papas.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.(n)

programme.title: Birdman: Or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance) (2014)
programme.desc: A faded movie star famous for his role in a series of superhero movies 20 years previously tries to reclaim his artisitic integrity by directing and starring in a Broadway play. The experience plunges him into a personal crisis as both the production and his own family are beset by a series of disasters. Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Keaton, Edward Norton and Emma Stone.(n)

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: Raw recruits undergo harsh training under a domineering Marine drill sergeant after being called up for service in the Vietnam War, but his brutal methods lead to the breakdown of one of his cadets. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey.(n)

programme.title: American Beauty
programme.desc: A suburban family man has a mid-life crisis when he becomes infatuated with a friend of his teenage daughter. Struggling to cope with the unhealthy attention her father is lavishing on her friend, the girl begins a tentative relationship of her own, while her harassed mother is also having an affair. Sam Mendes' Oscar-winning black comedy drama, starring Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch, Mena Suvari and Wes Bentley.(n)

programme.title: The Kingdom of Dreams and Madness
programme.desc: Premiere. Documentary charting a year behind the scenes at Japanese animation powerhouse Studio Ghibli in the run-up to the releases of The Wind Rises and The Tale of the Princess Kaguya. The film captures the pressures of producing top-flight animation, including glimpses from brainstorming meetings and voice artists' auditions and recording sessions, and features in-depth interviews with co-founders Hayao Miyazaki and Isao Takahata and other key members of the studio. In Japanese.

programme.title: The Great St Trinian's Train Robbery
programme.desc: A crook and his cronies stash the money from a train heist in a deserted old mansion, planning to recover it in good time. However, several years later, when the thieves arrive to collect their loot, they discover the building has been turned into a school for girls where the pupils have become infamous for their escapades. Comedy, starring Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, Reg Varney and George Cole.

programme.title: Ramona and Beezus
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Ramona has a vivid imagination and an unfortunate habit of accidentally causing trouble for herself and everyone else. When her father is fired from his job, the family's lives are thrown into upheaval, and Ramona puts her mind to the task of making sure they do not lose their home. Comedy based on Beverly Cleary's series of books, starring Joey King and Selena Gomez.

programme.title: The Harry Hill Movie
programme.desc: The quirky comedian is tricked into thinking his hamster has only one week to live, so he and his nan decide to grant the pet's dying wish of a holiday in Blackpool. However, they do not realise they have fallen into a trap set by Harry's evil twin brother. Comedy, starring Harry Hill, Julie Walters, Matt Lucas and Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Chef
programme.desc: Premiere. Carl Casper quits his job at a prestigious Los Angeles restaurant after refusing to compromise his creative integrity for the owner, and takes to the road to reignite his passion for the kitchen. He ends up in Miami, where he teams up with his ex-wife, his friend and his son to launch a food truck. Comedy, directed by and starring Jon Favreau. with Robert Downey Jr, Scarlett Johansson and Dustin Hoffman.

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: The Archangel Michael turns his back on Heaven and travels to a small-town diner to protect a pregnant waitress and her unborn child from God's wrath. Action fantasy, starring Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Lucas Black, Tyrese Gibson, Adrianne Palicki and Willa Holland.

programme.title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
programme.desc: Troubled computer hacker Lisbeth is framed for three murders and forced to flee for her life. As her journalist friend Mikael searches for evidence of her innocence, he discovers connections with a sex-trafficking ring, government corruption and Lisbeth's own traumatic past. Thriller sequel to The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, starring Noomi Rapace and Michael Nyqvist. In Swedish, Italian and French.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: A Monster in Paris
programme.desc: A would-be inventor accidentally creates a monster which escapes onto the streets of Paris. As the scientist and his sidekick try to find their creation before the police do, the creature befriends a kindly cabaret singer, who discovers he has a gentle nature and a gift for music. Animated comedy, with the voices of Vanessa Paradis and Sean Lennon.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Cellmates Fletcher and Godber are coerced into aiding an escape attempt organised by the sinister Grouty. However, the two jailbirds contrive to break back into prison before their absence is detected by the formidable Mr Mackay. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale, Peter Vaughan, Fulton Mackay and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Epic
programme.desc: A teenager wanders into a forest that her scientist father believes is home to a race of miniature people. She stumbles on the tiny creatures and is shrunk down to their size so she can carry out a quest to save their new queen from an invading army. Animated adventure, with the voices of Amanda Seyfried, Josh Hutcherson, Colin Farrell and Christoph Waltz.(n)

programme.title: My Sister's Keeper
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter develops leukaemia have another child to eventually provide a donor organ for her sister. However, as the younger child enters her teens and learns why she was born, she rejects the arrangement and hires a lawyer to seek legal separation from her parents. Drama, starring Cameron Diaz, Abigail Breslin and Alec Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Riddick
programme.desc: A fugitive is left for dead by his treacherous followers on a dangerous world full of lethal predators. He lures bounty hunters to the planet in the hope of killing them and stealing their spacecraft, but finds himself forced to work with them against an attack by the monsters at the top of the food chain. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel and Katee Sackhoff.(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead
programme.desc: Five friends travel to a remote woodland cabin, hoping one of them can conquer her drug addiction by going cold turkey. They uncover a mysterious book that, when read, unleashes demonic forces that possess the living and transform them into bloodthirsty zombies. Horror remake, starring Jane Levy and Shiloh Fernandez.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. John searches for a missing soldier, Jim Bob is attacked by a grieving father, and the family receives distressing news from the front line.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin comes to stay with the family, bringing her grandchildren, and becomes determined to make Olivia's life easier.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles, Mr Edwards and two other men take on a dangerous job.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles agrees to do some jobs for a widowed neighbour, but the amount of time he spends at her house makes his children suspicious.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's A Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A woman resigned to nursing her bedridden husband is swept off her feet by a handsome stranger and soon realises she is falling in love - but guilt and responsibility get the better of her. Romantic drama, starring Stacy Haiduk, Robert Urich and Darren McGavin.

programme.title: Crimes of Passion: Victim of Love
programme.desc: A sinister killer marries then murders a naive woman, prompting her parents to begin a relentless fight to bring him to justice. Fact-based drama, with Dwight Schultz, Bonnie Bartlett, Andy Romano and Dennis Boutsikaris.

programme.title: Hearts Adrift
programme.desc: A mother and daughter's humdrum small-town life is radically changed by a trip to spend a weekend with a family friend in the country. Romantic drama, starring Sydney Penny, Scott Reeves, Kathleen Noone and Nicolas Coster.

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.

programme.title: Christmas Every Day
programme.desc: Glum teenager Billy Jackson refuses to get into the yuletide spirit, and lashes out at his exuberant younger sister, Sarah, telling her there is no Father Christmas. In response, young Sarah wishes it could be Christmas every day, and when her request comes true, sullen Billy is forced to relive the holiday over and over again until he is able to appreciate its significance. Festive fantasy, starring Erik von Detten, Bess Armstrong, Yvonne Zima and Robert Hays.

programme.title: The Christmas List
programme.desc: A shop assistant is frustrated at her lack of success at work and fed up with her boyfriend taking her for granted. She writes a list of the things she wants out of life, which ends up in the shop's mailbox for children's letters to Santa. Magically, her wishes start coming true, but not always in the way she hoped. Fantasy drama, starring Mimi Rogers, Rob Stewart and Stella Stevens.

programme.title: Ebbie
programme.desc: A high-flying but mean-hearted female department store executive is brought back down to earth with a bump by three spooks determined to put a smile on her face in preparation for the Christmas season's celebrations. Festive drama based on the Dickens' tale, starring Susan Lucci, Wendy Crewson, Ron Lea, Jeffrey DeMunn and Molly Parker.

programme.title: Sudden Fury
programme.desc: Three abused brothers are suspected of complicity in the murder of their callous adoptive parents. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Johnny Galecki, Gregory Harrison and Linda Kelsey.

programme.title: Common
programme.desc: One-off drama from Jimmy McGovern, exploring the possible consequences of the UK's Joint Enterprise law, by which more than one person can be charged with the same offence. Seventeen-year-old Johnjo gives his cousin Tony and some friends a lift to a pizza parlour for food, unaware their real intention is to `sort out' a local loudmouth. Things soon get out of hand, however, and an innocent bystander is fatally stabbed - and despite being in the car all the time, Johnjo finds himself charged with murder along with everyone else. Nico Mirallegro heads a cast that also includes Susan Lynch, Daniel Mays, Jodhi May, Robert Pugh and Michelle Fairley.

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John cannot find his high school diploma, so is forced to take a test to prove to the army that he graduated. Mary Ellen takes over from the county nurse.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia campaigns for setting up a nursery for the children of defence plant workers, while the Godseys' anniversary celebrations are ruined by jealousy.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Walnut Grove celebrates the centennial of the United States, but the party is threatened with cancellation when taxes go up - while a Russian immigrant faces losing his home.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mrs Whipple's son returns home after fighting in the Civil War, but the trauma of the conflict has left him with an addiction to morphine.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Secrets
programme.desc: The cast of a glossy American TV series' steamy on-screen relationships pale in comparison with their behind-the-scenes antics. Drama, starring Stephanie Beacham, Christopher Plummer, Linda Purl, Gary Collins and Ben Browder.(n)

programme.title: A War of Children
programme.desc: A Catholic girl angers her friends and family by falling for a British soldier in the tense atmosphere of 1970s Belfast. Romantic drama, starring Jenny Agutter, John Ronane, Anthony Andrews and Danny Figgis.(n)

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.(n)

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.(n)

programme.title: A Christmas Wedding Date
programme.desc: A woman returns to her home town after 10 years away to attend a wedding, and ends up magically reliving the day over and over again. The experience gives her a chance to see a different side to the people she has rejected to further her career, and she rebuilds bridges with her mother and her high-school boyfriend. Comedy, with Marla Sokoloff and Chris Carmack.(n)

programme.title: I'll Be Home for Christmas
programme.desc: A couple in a small New England town during the Second World War await the return of their two sons and daughter for Christmas. Drama, starring Hal Holbrook, Eva Marie Saint, Jason Oliver, Courteney Cox, Peter Gallagher and Nancy Travis.(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Box
programme.desc: A hard-working man's obsession with his business causes him to neglect his family - but a series of strange dreams makes him realise it is the most important thing in his life. Drama, starring Richard Thomas and Maureen O'Hara.(n)

programme.title: The Babysitter's Seduction
programme.desc: When the wife of her wealthy employer is found dead, unsuspecting babysitter Michelle is drawn into a sinister plot and finds herself being accused of murder by a determined detective. Thriller, starring Keri Russell, Stephen Collins, Phylicia Rashad and Tobin Bell.(n)

programme.title: Till Death Us Do Part
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller about a Los Angeles district attorney who becomes increasingly obsessed with proving a cop is actually devious and dangerous con-man responsible for a string of murders, and vows to do whatever it takes to expose the truth. Treat Williams is on chilling form in the lead, while Arliss Howard, Rebecca Jenkins and Embeth Davidtz offer decent support.(n)

programme.title: Silence of the Heart
programme.desc: A teenage suicide shatters a seemingly typical American family, turning their lives upside-down as they struggle to cope with their grief. Drama, starring Charlie Sheen, Mariette Hartley, Dana Hill, Howard Hesseman and Chad Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan falls in love with a woman he is trying to matchmake with another man, and Mark tries to persuade him to put his own happiness first for a change.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: God grants Mark the chance to go back in time and tell his now deceased grandfather that he loved him.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A criminal flees into the Badlands to escape the partners in crime he betrayed, and a Native American woman comes to his aid. Guest starring John Saxon (A Nightmare on Elm Street).

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A teenager falls in with a gang of men who cut the hides of dead cattle, but Festus tries to persuade him to adopt a law-abiding lifestyle. Guest starring Ned Beatty.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica works with a man who appears to have all he needs and wants to be healthy and happy. However, when evil upsets things, Monica questions an old friend who is working with the man. Guest starring Stacy Keach.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Tess instructs Monica to respond to a news advert looking for an angel. Callie doubts Monica until she tells her about the cases she has worked on.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen goes on a date, but faces a troublesome dilemma between making a good impression and telling the truth.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy defends a freshman football player whom he previously accused of cheating, and Ben discovers the dangers of smoking.

programme.title: Desperate Choices: To Save My Child
programme.desc: A couple are devastated when their teenage daughter is diagnosed with leukaemia. Her only hope of survival is a bone-marrow transplant, but the only donor is her six-year-old brother, leaving their parents with a horrifying choice between watching one child die or putting the other through potentially life-threatening surgery. Drama, starring Joanna Kerns, Bruce Davison and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: My Body, My Child
programme.desc: A middle-aged Catholic woman becomes pregnant, but her doctor refuses to believe her and prescribes drugs that have unforeseen effects on her unborn child. She must choose between continuing the pregnancy, knowing her baby will be born severely deformed, or having an abortion in defiance of her faith. Drama, starring Vanessa Redgrave and Jack Albertson.

programme.title: My Father, My Son
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a US Navy Admiral's decision to use the Agent Orange defoliant during the Vietnam campaign - and the bitter realisation that it may have caused the cancer subsequently contracted by his soldier son. Starring Karl Malden, Keith Carradine, Dirk Blocker, Grace Zabriskie and Jenny Lewis.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Elizabeth dreads the prospect of her 13th birthday, Jason enjoys his new job as a radio presenter, and supernatural forces seem to be at work in the family home.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Sarah Carter is jealous when her son Jason makes friends with lonely newcomer Ruthy Leland. Vera Miles guest stars.

programme.title: Family Rescue
programme.desc: A teenager is raped and becomes pregnant by her mother's boyfriend - but to her horror, the court grants him custody of the child. Drama, starring George C Scott, Rachael Leigh Cook, Dom Diamont and Ally Sheedy.

programme.title: Any Mother's Son
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, chronicling the story of a US Navy seaman murdered while on leave in Japan. Desperate to see her son's killers pay for their crime, his mother - accompanied only by his sister and a reporter - embarks on a mission to see justice done. Starring Kenner Ames, Shawn Ashmore and Trevor Bain.

programme.title: Freshman Fall
programme.desc: A student is raped while drunk at her brother's fraternity party, and tries to find a way to bring her attacker to justice. Drama, with Candace Cameron Bure, Mark-Paul Gosselaar and Bess Armstrong.

programme.title: For the Love of a Child
programme.desc: Two inspirational women who carry out extensive work with abused, neglected and abandoned children around the world. Drama, starring Peri Gilpin, Teri Polo and Maria Del Mar.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan comes to the aid of an illiterate basketball player whose career has been cut short by ill health, and helps him learn to read so he can secure a future outside the sport.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan tries to reunite a dying woman with her disapproving father, who has never forgiven her for having a child out of wedlock.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Newly escorts a prisoner to jail, but finds his captive is being stalked by bounty hunters after the reward money.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A teacher believes that all children should get an education, but finds the parents of Dodge City do no agree. Guest starring John Vernon (National Lampoon's Animal House).(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: The angels are assigned to help a high-flying TV reporter racked with guilt over her involvement in a tragic hit-and-run incident. Starring Roma Downey, Della Reese and Diahann Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: The angels get involved in a family twist. Sam spontaneously proposes to Megan, his childhood sweetheart, but his mother refuses to give her blessing when she finds out Megan is HIV positive.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The arrival of a sophisticated family from New York has unenviable consequences for the Waltons.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy disobeys his mother and enters a week-long dance marathon with a pretty girl from a neighbouring town.(n)

programme.title: Between Love and Hate
programme.desc: A shy college boy goes to work as a swimming instructor at an exclusive country club during the summer holidays - only to become besotted with the wealthy mother of one of his pupils. Drama, starring Susan Lucci and Patrick Von Horn.(n)

programme.title: Murder So Sweet
programme.desc: A woman becomes convinced her smooth-talking ex-husband is responsible for the death of his latest wife, and persuades a detective to help prove her hunch. Mystery thriller, starring Harry Hamlin, Helen Shaver, KT Oslin and Terence Knox.(n)

programme.title: Complex of Fear
programme.desc: A rookie cop is assigned the tough case of tracking down a killer wreaking havoc among the residents of a housing development - and all the clues point to one of his friends. Thriller, starring Joe Don Baker, Hart Bochner and Chelsea Field.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Erin is attracted to a troubled artist, who asks to paint her picture. Grandma buys a canary, but finds it refuses to sing.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Willie Oleson's parents are shocked when their son announces he is planning to get married.(n)

programme.title: Judgment Day: The John List Story
programme.desc: An apparently respectable, mild-mannered accountant who was abused as a child finally snaps under the pressure of his pent-up emotion. Tormented by the past, the once devoted family man cold-heartedly slaughters his wife and children - before embarking on a lengthy race to escape the FBI. Fact-based drama, starring Robert Blake, Beverly D'Angelo, David Caruso and Melinda Dillon.(n)

programme.title: Sleeping with the Devil
programme.desc: A woman's life is turned upside down by the discovery that her seemingly perfect boyfriend is psychotically unbalanced and, as his mania increases, he pays a killer to gun her down. Drama, starring Shannen Doherty, Tim Matheson, Bonnie Bartlett and Steve Eastin.(n)

programme.title: Out of the Ashes
programme.desc: A Holocaust survivor heads for America where she dreams of starting a new life, but finds it difficult to put the past behind her - especially when she's forced to relive the nightmare of Auschwitz. Drama, starring Christine Lahti, Richard Crenna and Beau Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: A portrait of Frank Dux, the first Westerner to win the Kumite, a deadly martial-arts contest. Based on actual events(n)

programme.title: The War
programme.desc: Drama with Kevin Costner as a Vietnam veteran trying to get his domestic life back on track. Stephen Simmons has returned from the war a scarred man - both physically and mentally. While his wife Lois tries to come to terms with the changes which have occurred in Stephen's personality, their son Stu and daughter Lidia find themselves facing their own problems with a local gang of kids who want to take over the Simmons' tree-house(n)

programme.title: Dennis Rodman's Big Bang in Pyongyang
programme.desc: Chronicling Dennis Rodman's trip to North Korea for a basketball tournament, and his interactions with Kim Jong-un(n)

programme.title: 1492: Conquest of Paradise
programme.desc: Ridley Scott's film, released on the 500th anniversary of the discovery of the Americas, stars Gérard Depardieu as Columbus, from his early days persuading Queen Isabella (Sigourney Weaver) to fund his explorations to the discoveries themselves, the effect on the native Indians, the growing colonisation and finally his death on the continent he discovered(n)

programme.title: Bronx Obama
programme.desc: This stranger-than-fiction documentary follows unemployed Bronx resident Louis Ortiz, whose chance resemblance to Barack Obama opened up a new, lucrative career as a presidential impersonator -- but not without compromising his values and identity(n)

programme.title: Match
programme.desc: An aging Juilliard dance teacher must face his painful past during an interview with a grad student. Ultimately, the talk could lead to healing or despair for the interviewer's emotionally damaged husband(n)

programme.title: Shopgirl
programme.desc: Anand Tucker's film is written by Steve Martin, based on the actor's novel and also stars him as Ray Porter, a millionaire who falls for shy shopgirl Mirabelle Buttersfield. She's an aspiring artist working to pay off her student fees and not only does he sweep her off her feet, but also he pays for everything. The second man in her life is Jeremy, who's an artist too - well, he stencils the boxes that amps come in. He's a slacker but he loves her, while to Porter, she's merely an acquisition. The film tenderly and perceptively observes Mirabelle's predicament as the men's characters, warts and all, are drawn out and she is placed in the position where she must choose one or the other(n)

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: After the death of his father, a young man whose life is falling apart, returns to his hometown to take care of his mentally ill sister(n)

programme.title: Roadies (?)
programme.desc: Carpet Season.(n)

programme.title: Jane Wants a Boyfriend
programme.desc: A lonely autistic woman begins a relationship with a charming chef, despite the misgivings of her caring but protective sister(n)

programme.title: Sleeping With Other People
programme.desc: Lainey (Alison Brie) and Jake (Jason Sudeikis) lost their virginities to each other in college, and they meet again, years later, when they attend the same meeting for sex addiction. Both of their love lives are disasters, and after rekindling their friendship, they vow to keep their relationship platonic so they can help each other with their problems: Jake is a womanizer who can't commit, while Lainey hasn't gotten over a married doctor (Adam Scott) she's been having an affair with. In time, Jake falls for a high-powered businesswoman (Amanda Peet) who buys his start-up company, while Lainey starts dating a financier (Marc Blucas). Yet through it all, they feel closer to each other than to any of their actual partners. Jason Mantzoukas and Andrea Savage co-star as a married couple who are friends with Jake, and who pressure him to settle down to avoid being the weird single guy at their parties (the end credits feature a hilarious sequence in which the two of them banter about the state of their marriage). Sleeping With Other People was written and directed by Leslye Headland(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Norman Saves the World. A long-buried scandal leads Ray to an unexpected confrontation(n)

programme.title: Roadies
programme.desc: Carpet Season. Bill, Reg and Phil set off on a quest to retrieve Christopher's stolen iPad. Meanwhile, a famously idiosyncratic rock photographer arrives to shoot the band and causes chaos backstage(n)

programme.title: War
programme.desc: Jet Li and Jason Statham star in this fast paced action thriller, directed by Phillip G. Atwell. Statham plays an FBI agent determined to take down a mysterious assassin known as Rogue (Li), after his partner is murdered(n)

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: After the death of his father, a young man whose life is falling apart, returns to his hometown to take care of his mentally ill sister(n)

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: A British soldier who was held as a prisoner of war by the Japanese during WWII confronts the guard who tortured him in order to find closure to that painful chapter of his life(n)

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: Hugh Grant and the team from Four Weddings and a Funeral return for this blockbusting, BAFTA-winning romantic comedy set in the eponymous London district. Grant stars as a self-effacing bookshop owner who literally bumps into a major American movie star - and falls instantly in love(n)

programme.title: Compared to What? The Improbable Journey of Barney Frank
programme.desc: An affectionate yet honest profile of Democratic congressman Barney Frank during his final year in office, as he reflects on his journey as a pioneering, openly gay politician(n)

programme.title: Wrong Side of Town
programme.desc: When a former Navy SEAL incurs the wrath of a dangerous gangster, he must mend fences with an old friend in order to escape death and protect his family(n)

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: A British soldier who was held as a prisoner of war by the Japanese during WWII confronts the guard who tortured him in order to find closure to that painful chapter of his life(n)

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: Hugh Grant and the team from Four Weddings and a Funeral return for this blockbusting, BAFTA-winning romantic comedy set in the eponymous London district. Grant stars as a self-effacing bookshop owner who literally bumps into a major American movie star - and falls instantly in love(n)

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: Cate Blanchett stars in Sam Raimi's psychological thriller as a widow 'blessed' with psychic powers. When she's asked to help investigate the brutal murder of a society girl, she uncovers a web of deceit and lies that the Georgia townsfolk hide behind. And as the investigation gathers pace, her life is increasingly placed in danger(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Norman Saves the World. A long-buried scandal leads Ray to an unexpected confrontation(n)

programme.title: Roadies
programme.desc: Carpet Season. Bill, Reg and Phil set off on a quest to retrieve Christopher's stolen iPad. Meanwhile, a famously idiosyncratic rock photographer arrives to shoot the band and causes chaos backstage(n)

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: James Wan's mould-breaking crime-horror opens in a derelict public toilet. Two men, Adam and Dr Lawrence Gordon, are chained to the walls by leg irons. Between them are a corpse, a gun, a tape recorder and a saw. They are the latest victims of The Jigsaw Killer, a serial killer with a penchant for setting up bizarre scenarios for his victims (the film shows some of his previous grisly escapades) and as they find out, only one of them will walk (or rather, hobble) to freedom. On the killer's trail are cops David Tapp and Steven Sing, but can they find his latest victims before time runs out?(n)

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: Jigsaw, the diabolical criminal who captured the imagination of horror fans in the 2004 hit Saw, returns in this equally bloody sequel. Eric Matthews (Donnie Wahlberg) is a police detective who, after discovering the aftermath of a particularly gruesome murder, is convinced that Jigsaw (Tobin Bell) is up to his ugly tricks again. Matthews' hunch turns out to be correct, but the master criminal proves to be disconcertingly easy to capture. As it happens, Jigsaw is eager to be put behind bars in order to throw the authorities off his trail as he once again punishes people who in his eyes have transgressed the boundaries of acceptable moral behavior. But instead of trapping two people in a filthy dungeon where they must engage in a terrible contest in order to win their freedom, eight people have been locked away by Jigsaw, and they must torture their bodies and minds to achieve the terrible justice Jigsaw seeks. Saw II was written by Leigh Whannell, who also scripted the first film(n)

programme.title: It Follows
programme.desc: In the wake of sleeping with a handsome stranger, a young woman quickly learns that she has inherited a most unusual curse: wherever she goes, lumbering, half-naked phantoms follow, and their singular goal is to see her dead(n)

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: A high school student discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Arthur & Merlin
programme.desc: A banished warrior and a hermit wizard must team up to battle a powerful druid in an effort to save the Celt people in the dark ages of Britain(n)

programme.title: Judgment Day
programme.desc: This sci-fi thriller finds the world in imminent danger when a collision in outer space sends huge pieces of interstellar debris on a path headed straight for Earth. A scientist has designed a system that would stop the largest meteor fragments from striking the earth, but a fanatical religious cult have made it their business to stop him. A convicted murderer (Ice-T) with ties to the group must now join forces with an FBI agent (Suzy Amis) to free the scientist from the cult's clutches and prevent millions of needless deaths. Mario Van Peebles and Linden Ashby appear in supporting roles(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: The story of a police robot named Chappie, who develops the ability to think and feel for himself. As people fight back against the mechanised police force, sinister forces seek to capture Chappie for their nefarious purposes(n)

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E.
programme.desc: Recently orphaned teen Isabel (Sarah Desjardins) finds a sympathetic friend in a stray terrier, but soon it's revealed that her canine pal is actually an experimental android with enhanced strength and speed, x-ray vision, and the power of speech. Now teen and dog must work together to defeat an encroaching burger franchise and evade an interloper eager to snatch the robot pup(n)

programme.title: The Hunters
programme.desc: A power-crazed villain finds his mission to acquire a precious mythical artifact thwarted by a pair of young adventurers who are sworn to protect history's most prized treasures in this globe-trotting fantasy adventure. The stories of legend are true, and the magical relics owned by such celebrated figures as Cinderella really exist. The malevolent force known as The Krugen knows well that the owner of these objects will reap ultimate power, because by obtaining the magical mirror once owned by the Evil Queen who tormented Snow White, they were able to herald the arrival of the Dark Ages. Centuries later, former Hunter Mason has become a loyal servant of The Krugen. He knows that once he locates all of the pieces of the mirror no one will be able to challenge his evil reign. But Jordyn and Carter Flynn hail from a long line of Hunters, and they've got just the skills to prevent Mason from achieving his diabolical plan. When Jordyn and Carter learn that their parents have gone missing during an important mission, they vow to track them down, and head off a disaster that could alter the entire course of history(n)

programme.title: The Condemned
programme.desc: Wrestling superstar "Stone Cold" Steve Austin packs a wallop in this action-packed adventure. He plays Jack Conrad, a convicted murderer who's purchased from a Central American prison and sent to battle nine other killers in a made-for-TV death match that is being broadcast as part of a reality-television extravaganza. Former European soccer star Vinnie Jones costars as McStarley, a sociopathic former Special Forces operative. Directed by Scott Wiper, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
programme.desc: One of the most infamous horror films of the 1970s is revisited in this remake produced by action-spectacle maven Michael Bay. In the summer of 1973, four teenagers -- Erin (Jessica Biel), Morgan (Jonathan Tucker), Kemper (Eric Balfour), and Andy (Mike Vogel) -- are driving through Texas on a road trip when they pick up a hitchhiker, Pepper (Erica Leerhsen), who is on her way to Mexico to score some dope. With Pepper adding to the party atmosphere, the other four decide to join her, but as they're passing through a small town in Travis County, they see a bloody and distraught girl (Lauren German) wandering by the side of the road, and after stopping to help her, they realize she's been involved in something horribly traumatic. As the kids try to help the girl piece together the story of what happened, they find themselves drawn into the web of a murderous family of subnormal cannibals. Inspired -- like the original Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Psycho, The Silence of the Lambs, and Deranged -- by the crimes of Wisconsin multiple murderer Ed Gein, this remake of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre also features narration by John Larroquette, who narrated the original film (it was his first screen credit), as well as supporting performances by R. Lee Ermey, Andrew Prine, and Andrew Bryniarski(n)

programme.title: Amigo Undead
programme.desc: A camping trip among friends goes awry when a guys dies and they bury him in cursed soil, which leads to unexpected supernatural events(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. One man, who has become amphibious, tries to protect a group of survivors by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Stake Land
programme.desc: An orphaned teenager joins a stoic vampire hunter and a desperate group of survivors as they search for a safe haven in a land overrun by monstrous bloodsuckers and ruthless fundamentalists intent on taking over the United States. His entire family slaughtered by vampires, terrified teen Martin (Connor Paolo) is rescued from certain death by a mysterious vampire hunter named Mister (Nick Damici), who trains him how to wield a wooden stake as they wander the wastelands in search of survivors. Before long, the duo is joined by conflicted nun Sister (Kelly McGillis), resourceful youngster Willie (Sean Nelson), and a pregnant teenager (Danielle Harris) looking for a safe place to give birth. With supplies running low and safe houses hard to come by, the group sets their sights on a place known as "New Eden," the last stronghold of humanity. But getting there won't be easy because the crazed fundamentalists who travel the roads by day are even more dangerous than the evil bloodsuckers who stalk the darkness(n)

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: In the chilling eighth installment of the series, a group of frightened teens tries to live through the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of an Internet contest set up by an entrepreneur (Busta Rhymes). Little do they know that someone is in the house waiting for them. Jamie Lee Curtis, Ryan Merriman, Bianca Kajlich, Thomas Ian Nicholas(n)

programme.title: The Condemned
programme.desc: Wrestling superstar "Stone Cold" Steve Austin packs a wallop in this action-packed adventure. He plays Jack Conrad, a convicted murderer who's purchased from a Central American prison and sent to battle nine other killers in a made-for-TV death match that is being broadcast as part of a reality-television extravaganza. Former European soccer star Vinnie Jones costars as McStarley, a sociopathic former Special Forces operative. Directed by Scott Wiper, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Let Us Prey
programme.desc: Rachel is a rookie cop ready to begin her first night shift in the local police station of small Scottish, backwater town. However, this is a night she will never forget; for when Six arrives...all hell will break loose, with Rachel caught right in the centre of it(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre

Lee Ermey, Andrew Prine, and Andrew Bryniarski(n)

programme.title: Backcountry
programme.desc: A high-powered executive and her boyfriend go on a weekend camping trip in the Canadian wilderness. Unfortunately, the couple get lost during a hike, and end up being hunted by a vicious black bear in this terrifying thriller(n)

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Apollo 13 meets Spy Kids in this family action. Jimmy Hawkins defies his ex-astronaut dad to enter a NASA competition in the hope of winning a spot on the next space shuttle. But space camp fun takes a serious turn when the International Space Station runs into trouble and the real NASA boffins can't rescue the astronauts onboard(n)

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: A revolution brews on a train containing the last of humanity in this thrilling sci-fi film set during a new ice age. When the lower classes in the back cars invade the upper classes in the front, the superpowered locomotive speeds toward tragedy(n)

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: Director Eduardo Sanchez ("The Blair Witch Project") helmed this frightening chiller about newlyweds Yul and Melissa (Tim Chiou, Amy Smart), who arrive in China to meet Yul's family only to have their idyllic getaway take a turn for the worse after they become stranded in a remote village(n)

programme.title: Backcountry
programme.desc: A high-powered executive and her boyfriend go on a weekend camping trip in the Canadian wilderness. Unfortunately, the couple get lost during a hike, and end up being hunted by a vicious black bear in this terrifying thriller(n)

programme.title: Willow Creek
programme.desc: A young couple search for Bigfoot in California's Six Rivers National Forest, where a series of disturbing events leave them deeply shaken. Uncertain if they've stumbled onto Sasquatch or simply roused hostile locals, they decide to flee(n)

programme.title: Summer of Blood
programme.desc: A single, commitment-phobic urbanite (writer/director Onur Turkel) rejects a marriage proposal from his career oriented girlfriend, and finds his self-confidence eroded following a series of disastrous dates. Subsequently turned into a vampire, the only thing stronger than his unquenchable thirst for blood is his unrelenting drive to get laid(n)

programme.title: Lumberjack Man
programme.desc: A demonic lumberjack terrorizes the staff of a church camp as they prepare for spring break(n)

programme.title: Bloodworx
programme.desc: Two college roommates enroll in a clinical drug trial in order to make some quick cash, but get more than they bargained for after agreeing to spend 14 days in a secluded medical facility(n)

programme.title: Animals
programme.desc: This heartwrenching tale of addiction follows a young homeless couple who fund their drug binges through theft. Later, their lifestyle comes crashing down when one of them is hospitalized(n)

programme.title: House of Lies
programme.desc: Boom. Marty and Jeannie pit rival grocery clients against one another, but things don't go quite as planned. Meanwhile, changes at Galweather cause trouble for Jeannie; and Clyde's already difficult work situation under Monica becomes even more brutal when he is forced to work from her home(n)

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Curtis Hanson ( LA Confidential ) came up trumps again with this Oscar- nominated comedy drama. College professor Michael Douglas is having writer's block on his follow-up to his acclaimed first novel, his affair with married chancellor Frances McDormand has resulted in her pregnancy and student Katie Holmes, boarding at his home, is getting a crush on him... Douglas, playing the cardigan-clad shaggy professor bemused at what life has thrown at him is superb and the supporting cast of Tobey Maguire, Robert Downey Jnr and Rip Torn all add to this genuine gem of a movie(n)

programme.title: Lost in the Sun
programme.desc: In this riveting, emotionally-charged drama, a petty thief and his cohort, a recently orphaned teen boy, embark on a road trip adventure that involves multiple robberies and results in a strong connection between the two(n)

programme.title: All Things Must Pass: The Rise and Fall of Tower Records
programme.desc: A look at the rise and fall of Tower Records, a chain of music stores that went out of business after entering bankruptcy in 2004(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in Sofia Coppola's Oscar-winning romantic comedy-drama as over-the-hill actor Bob Harris, who is lured to Tokyo to 'act' in a whisky commercial in return for big money. In the hotel bar he bumps into Charlotte who has been left to her own devices while her husband, a successful photographer, is on an assignment. Two strangers in an unfamiliar city, they form a friendship that slips into tenderness as they recognise each other's vulnerability. By turn comic and touching, the duo turn in pitch-perfect performances(n)

programme.title: Good Kill
programme.desc: A disillusioned drone pilot, who controls spy aircrafts hovering over the Middle East from a trailer in Las Vegas, begins to feel morally disconnected from his military orders(n)

programme.title: W. Kamau Bell: Semi-Prominent Negro
programme.desc: Comedy special featuring socio-political comedian W. Kamau Bell, who brings his characteristically biting take on the real issues of contemporary America from gentrification to raising his family in a post-Obama nation(n)

programme.title: Scenarios USA Shorts: House Not Home
programme.desc: A gender fluid teenager navigates bullying and violence from peers and rejection from a parent on the journey out of the closet(n)

programme.title: Tart
programme.desc: Cat Storm (Dominique Swain) is a bored high school girl in New York City who follows her petulant, rich friends from one coming-of-age adventure to another. They experiment with cruelty, rudeness, brazenness, and idiocy before moving onto sex and drugs. Cat's best friend, Delilah (Bijou Phillips), is kicked out of school for using cocaine (her father's), forcing Cat to become best friends with Grace (Mischa Barton), who guides her into the arms of William (Brad Renfro), the boy Cat's had a crush on for some time. Eventually they all wind up at a luxurious country estate for a weekend of drugs, passion, and, inevitably, gruesome murder(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in Sofia Coppola's Oscar-winning romantic comedy-drama as over-the-hill actor Bob Harris, who is lured to Tokyo to 'act' in a whisky commercial in return for big money. programme.title: Angels of Darkness
programme.desc: A story of girls of the street, and how a series of events changes their lives(n)

programme.title: House of Lies
programme.desc: Associates. Marty welcomes Jeannie back into the fold, before turning his attention to the company's newest clients, a pair of hip-hop clothing moguls(n)

programme.title: Hostel: Part II
programme.desc: Three American students in Rome take a semester break and wind up in a Slovakian chamber of horrors. The shockingly creepy sequel was written and directed by Eli Roth, who also did the 2005 original. Bijou Phillips, Lauren German and Heather Matarazzo portray the classmates. Quentin Tarantino served as executive producer. Jay Hernandez and Derek Richardson, who starred in the first film, have cameos. Roger Bart, Richard Burgi, Jana Kaderabkova(n)

programme.title: Heartless
programme.desc: A young photographer with a huge, red heart-shaped birthmark on his face learns that reptilian monsters are posing as street gangs in London. Their leader offers to remove his facial disfigurement in return for performing some evil deeds(n)

programme.title: All Things Must Pass: The Rise and Fall of Tower Records
programme.desc: A look at the rise and fall of Tower Records, a chain of music stores that went out of business after entering bankruptcy in 2004(n)

programme.title: Passion of Mind
programme.desc: Demi Moore sinks her teeth into dual roles in this romantic fantasy. She plays Marty, a successful but stressed-out New York career woman. In her dreams, she's transported to Southern France, where she is Marie, living a kinder, gentler bohemian life. Stellan Skarsgard, William Fichtner, Sinead Cusack, Peter Rigert(n)

programme.title: Skinwalkers
programme.desc: A pack of biker werewolves try to get their claws on a half-boy, half-wolf 12-year-old who is destined to end their lineage when he turns 13(n)

programme.title: Unnatural
programme.desc: Genetically created polar bears run amok and terrorize everyone in sight after they are created by a company seeking to take advantage of global warming(n)

programme.title: Nightlight
programme.desc: In this innovative thriller, teens playing a spooky flashlight game in haunted woods at night get more than they bargained when a demon is awakened by their shenanigans(n)

programme.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
programme.desc: Docudrama about a 1971 psychological experiment in which 24 male undergrads at Stanford were asked to role-play as guards and inmates in a mock prison setting(n)

programme.title: Inside Money
programme.desc: Topic: mutual-fund newsletters. Rick Dupuis is the program host(n)

programme.title: The Dramatics
programme.desc: When an actress lands a sexually explicit role, her unhappy boyfriend must either accept it or risk losing her(n)

programme.title: Ben Gleib: Neurotic Gangster
programme.desc: Satirical comedian Ben Gleib performs a stand-up routine in which he social media, singledom, vegetarians and everything in between(n)

programme.title: Unnatural
programme.desc: Genetically created polar bears run amok and terrorize everyone in sight after they are created by a company seeking to take advantage of global warming(n)

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: A high school student discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Skinwalkers
programme.desc: A pack of biker werewolves try to get their claws on a half-boy, half-wolf 12-year-old who is destined to end their lineage when he turns 13(n)

programme.title: The Wraith
programme.desc: In a small desert town, an otherworldly stranger returns to wage a vendetta against those who have made him a phantom. He also has a woman's love to reclaim(n)

programme.title: Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives
programme.desc: Popular '90s hip-hop DJs Stretch and Bobbito are profiled in this documentary(n)

programme.title: Pride
programme.desc: An unlikely friendship is forged between a small community of striking miners in Wales and a team of London-based gay-and-lesbian activists who help fight their cause. With no end to the strike in sight, the urban activists venture into the countryside to deliver their donation in person, and find they have more in common with the people of this struggling community than anyone on either side could have expected(n)

programme.title: Mr. Holland's Opus
programme.desc: A frustrated composer finds his calling in teaching while raising a hearing-impaired son(n)

programme.title: Atari: Game Over
programme.desc: An exploration of the decline of video-game giant Atari and its secret burial of unsold "E.T." game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill(n)

programme.title: Deterrence
programme.desc: The world's on the brink of doomsday in this riveting political thriller set in 2008. Kevin Pollak stars as the U.S. president, who, while snowed in at a Colorado diner, must decide whether to use nuclear force to respond to an Iraqi military offensive. Timothy Hutton, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Sean Astin(n)

programme.title: Murder in the Dark
programme.desc: A group of campers hunker down in a medieval Turkish town and play a mysterious party game that quickly escalates into something far more sinister(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Girls
programme.desc: Timothy Hutton, facing marriage with trepidation, returns to his home town for a reunion with his schoolmates (including Matt Dillon and Michael Rapaport), and over the beers, they talk about their ideal woman, not seeing that Lauren Holly and Martha Plimpton, to name just two, would fit the bill if only they opened their eyes. Then Hutton meets Natalie Portman, who's beautiful, sassy, intelligent - and just 13. But through her friendship he finally learns to come to terms with his life(n)

programme.title: Dirty Weekend
programme.desc: In this kinky comedy-drama, business colleagues Les and Natalie are stuck in Albuquerque during a long layover. While Natalie considers cheating on her partner, Les decides to investigate a drunken affair he had the last time he was in the city(n)

programme.title: Boyhood
programme.desc: This unique drama, shot over the course of 12 years with the same cast, follows a boy named Mason from age 7 to when he leaves for college. Along the way, he deals with his parents' divorce, adjusts to new stepfamilies and explores his own identity(n)

programme.title: The Warrior's Way
programme.desc: A legendary Asian swordsman must fight for his life after giving up his warrior ways and hiding out in the American badlands in this Western-martial-arts hybrid(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A life-changing journey to East Africa causes former gang member Sam Childers to dedicate his life to rescuing children who were captured and trained as soldiers by the Lord's Resistance Army in this drama based on actual events(n)

programme.title: The Best Man
programme.desc: College friends reunite for a wedding, but the best man is nervous because his soon-to-be-published novel is based on secrets among his social circle—including a fling he once had with the bride(n)

programme.title: Pauly Shore Stands Alone
programme.desc: Documentary following comedian Pauly Shore on tour as he plays venues in small towns across the Midwest, deals with his ailing mother and reflects on his life outside of comedy(n)

programme.title: Animals
programme.desc: This heartwrenching tale of addiction follows a young homeless couple who fund their drug binges through theft. Later, their lifestyle comes crashing down when one of them is hospitalized(n)

programme.title: The Green Room With Paul Provenza
programme.sub-title: Robert Klein, Jonathan Winters and Rick Overton
programme.desc: Robert Klein, Jonathan Winters and Rick Overton. Robert Klein; Jonathan Winters; Rick Overton(n)

programme.title: Shopgirl
programme.desc: Anand Tucker's film is written by Steve Martin, based on the actor's novel and also stars him as Ray Porter, a millionaire who falls for shy shopgirl Mirabelle Buttersfield. She's an aspiring artist working to pay off her student fees and not only does he sweep her off her feet, but also he pays for everything. The second man in her life is Jeremy, who's an artist too - well, he stencils the boxes that amps come in. He's a slacker but he loves her, while to Porter, she's merely an acquisition. The film tenderly and perceptively observes Mirabelle's predicament as the men's characters, warts and all, are drawn out and she is placed in the position where she must choose one or the other(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in Sofia Coppola's Oscar-winning romantic comedy-drama as over-the-hill actor Bob Harris, who is lured to Tokyo to 'act' in a whisky commercial in return for big money. In the hotel bar he bumps into Charlotte who has been left to her own devices while her husband, a successful photographer, is on an assignment. Two strangers in an unfamiliar city, they form a friendship that slips into tenderness as they recognise each other's vulnerability. By turn comic and touching, the duo turn in pitch-perfect performances(n)

programme.title: Freedom
programme.desc: In 1856, a slave and his family escape from a plantation near Richmond via the Underground Railroad. A century earlier, the captain of a slave ship questions the morality of his mission(n)

programme.title: American Loser
programme.desc: An aimless slacker runs out of options when he gets kicked out of his home, but he soon moves in with a woman whom he met at a support group for people with relationship problems. Eventually, she inspires him to get his life together(n)

programme.title: The Culling
programme.desc: The plans of five college friends headed for a fun-filled weekend get abruptly changed when they find a 7-year-old girl alone at an empty café and have no choice but to drive her home. Once there, the group's worst nightmares are realized(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: The story of a police robot named Chappie, who develops the ability to think and feel for himself. As people fight back against the mechanised police force, sinister forces seek to capture Chappie for their nefarious purposes(n)

programme.title: As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM
programme.desc: Profiling DJ AM (aka Adam Goldstein), a hugely successful and influential disc jockey known for his mash-ups of popular songs. This intriguing documentary traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash(n)

When Okwe discovers a human heart blocking a toilet in a just-vacated room, he uncovers something far more sinister than just a common crime

programme.title: Last Knights
programme.desc: A corrupt medieval emperor exploits his citizens and rules his kingdom with impunity. When the nobleman and mentor Bartok (Morgan Freeman) refuses to pay a bribe to one of the emperor's cronies, a death sentence is placed upon him. Bartok's loyal followers are lead by Raiden (Clive Owen), a highly skilled warrior who is deeply affected by Bartok's murder. Raiden and his clan band together to fight back against the oppressive emperor in this medieval action thriller

programme.desc: Harrowing docudrama about a 1971 psychological experiment in which 24 male undergrads at Stanford were asked to role-play as guards and inmates in a mock prison setting

programme.title: Turbulence 3: Heavy Metal
programme.desc: Terrorists hijack an airplane that is broadcasting a rock concert live on the Internet

programme.title: Black Snake Moan
programme.desc: In this provocative and affecting character study, Samuel L. Jackson stars as a righteous Tennessee farmer who finds a beaten harlot (Christina Ricci) outside his house and does everything in his power to return her to the path of righteousness and salvation. Ricci is a revelation as the lust-in-the-dust wanton woman with deep-seated psychological problems. Written and directed by Craig Brewer. The film's title comes from the name of a blues standard by Blind Lemon Jefferson

programme.title: Basic Instinct 2
programme.desc: Sharon Stone reprises her role as novelist Catherine Trammell in Michael Caton-Jones slick upgrade of the iconic 90s thriller. This time the setting is London, and Trammell is the survivor of a suspect car crash that kills footballer Kevin Franks. Examined by psychiatrist Michael Glass, she escapes the murder charge, much to the frustration of cop Roy Washburn. Infatuated with Glass, Trammell starts to see him professionally, but when some of those closest to Glass end up murdered, he begins to wonder if his new client is the innocent woman she claims to be, or a risk-addicted murderous psychopath(n)

programme.desc: The Who perform in concert at London's Hyde Park on June 26, 2015. The 19-song playlist spans the band's 50-year history and includes "Who Are You," "Pinball Wizard" and "Won't Get Fooled Again."(n)

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: Re-teaming Dennis Quaid with John Lee Hancock, the director of 2002's The Rookie, The Alamo retells the story of the historic 1836 battle in the Texan War of Independence. Facing 4,000 Mexican troops, 186 Texan soldiers and volunteers -- including William Travis (Patrick Wilson), Davy Crockett (Billy Bob Thornton), and Jim Bowie (Jason Patric) -- retreat within the walls of the Alamo, a Franciscan mission that was converted into a military fort. Once inside, the men prepare themselves for what will be a bloody battle to the death, as General Sam Houston (Quaid) leads the charge from the outside. Emilio Echevarria and Jordi Molla co-star(n)

programme.desc: The first teen to come out of the closet at North Gateway High struggles to balance his newfound popularity with his longtime friendships as the three most popular girls in school all attempt to claim him as their G.B.F. (gay best friend). The moment Tanner (Michael J. Willett) reveals his true sexuality to his classmates he rockets up the social ladder. Suddenly, he's decked out in the latest fashions, and living it up with the in-crowd. Meanwhile, the friends who used to be part of Tanner's inner circle get left out in the cold. Now Tanner will be faced with the most difficult decision of his high school career -- keep riding the popularity train and accept his role as a human fashion accessory, or go back to the people who have always accepted him for who he really is. Megan Mullally, Jonathan Silverman, Rebecca Gayheart, and Natasha Lyonne co-star in a comedy from director Darren Stein(n)

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich's blockbuster of a science fiction film sees aliens reach Earth. And they're decidedly hostile - their plan is to suck the planet of all its resources and leave behind a burnt cinder circling the sun before moving on. Planting giant ships above the world's major cities, they unleash destruction on an unprecedented scale (superbly caught by the special effects). All attempts at fighting back are met by hordes of fighter craft until pilot Steven Hiller manages to down one and capture the pilot. In tandem, scientist David Levinson, having worked out their purpose, also works out a way to destroy them but he and Hiller need a space craft. Which brings them to a secret base near Las Vegas. The child of countless science fiction movies, Independence Day is rollicking, fast-moving fun and if the fate of the remains of the human race is never in doubt, there's enough tension and action to carry even the most jaundiced viewer along(n)

programme.title: Wild Wild West
programme.desc: Will Smith and director Barry Sonnenfeld last struck gold with the international blockbuster Men In Black and they re-team for this rollicking action adventure movie that puts a brand new spin on the Western. Smith plays government agent Jim West, who finds himself paired with fellow agent Artemus Gordon when Dr Arliss Loveless plots to assassinate the President. Both West and Gordon have their unique talents - Jim is a witty charmer who can talk his way out of any situation, while Artemus is a master of disguise with a dazzling talent for inventing things - and they'll need every trick in the book if they're to outwit their new nemesis. Look out for some spectacular special effects, including a giant transportation device known as The Tarantula, as well as Salma Hayek, who co-stars as the sassy love interest(n)

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: The devastating rage virus that annihilated the British Isles mysteriously resurfaces in Goya Award-winning director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo's sequel to the Danny Boyle-directed horror hit that terrified audiences worldwide by offering a breathless new take on the familiar zombie mythos. Six months has passed since the rage virus caused British residents to indiscriminately murder and destroy everything in their paths, and now the U.S. military has declared victory in the war against the rapidly spreading infection. As the reconstruction process gets underway and the first wave of refugees return to British shores, a family separated by the devastation is happily reunited. During the initial outbreak, Don Harris (Robert Carlyle) and his wife Alice (Catherine McCormack) sat holed up with a small band of survivors in a remote farmhouse. Their kids well out of harm's way at a remote boarding school, Don and Alice's outlook for the future is decidedly bright until all hell breaks loose in the country and Don just barely manages to escape the clutches of the infected. The joy of later seeing his son Andy (Mackintosh Muggleton) and daughter Tammy (Imogen Poots) as repopulation efforts get underway in London is short-lived, however, when an innocent bid to reconnect with the past sets into motion a tragic series of events. Now, just as society struggles to sort through the rubble and rebuild London from the ground up, the virus that nearly destroyed a nation strikes back with a vengeance. Jeremy Renner, Rose Byrne, and Harold Perrineau, Jr. co-star in the frightful sequel, which highlights the dangers of declaring victory in the calm before the storm(n)
